com.apriori.collections

Class BitConverters

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.apriori.collections.BitConverters

  • public final class BitConverters
extends Object
    Factory methods for useful BitConverter implementations. All of the implementations returned produce a sequence of bits in most-significant-bit-first order. Those that produce multi-byte values (e.g. the underlying object is greater than 8 bits) use big-endian ordering of bytes. This way, ordering values by their corresponding bit streams (assuming "false" is less than "true") tends to follow the values' natural ordering.

    • Method Detail

      • forSerializable

        public static <T extends Serializable> BitConverter<T> forSerializable()
        Returns a converter that will serialize a given object. The stream of bits corresponds to the bits in the resulting serialized bytes.

      • forByte

        public static BitConverter<Byte> forByte()
        Returns a converter that converts bytes into streams of eight bits.

      • forShort

        public static BitConverter<Short> forShort()
        Returns a converter that converts shorts into streams of sixteen bits.

      • forCharacter

        public static BitConverter<Character> forCharacter()
        Returns a converter that converts characters into streams of bits. The default character encoding is UTF-16BE, so most characters are represented as sixteen bits and will be ordered by their unicode code point.

      • forCharacter

        public static BitConverter<Character> forCharacter(Charset charset)
        Returns a converter that converts characters into stream of bits using the specified character encoding.

      • forInteger

        public static BitConverter<Integer> forInteger()
        Returns a converter that converts integers into streams of 32 bits.

      • forLong

        public static BitConverter<Long> forLong()
        Returns a converter that converts longs into streams of 64 bits.

      • forFloat

        public static BitConverter<Float> forFloat()
        Returns a converter that converts floats into streams of 32 bits. The bits will be the given value's representation in IEEE 754 single-precision layout.

      • forDouble

        public static BitConverter<Double> forDouble()
        Returns a converter that converts doubles into streams of 64 bits. The bits will be the given value's representation in IEEE 754 double-precision layout.

      • forString

        public static BitConverter<CharSequence> forString()
        Returns a converter that converts strings into streams of bits. The default character encoding is UTF-16BE, so most characters are represented as sixteen bits and will be ordered by their unicode code point. The first character in the string is considered "most significant".

      • forString

        public static BitConverter<CharSequence> forString(Charset charset)
        Returns a converter that converts strings into streams of bits using the specifed character encoding. The first character in the string is considered "most significant".

      • forBigInteger

        public static BitConverter<BigInteger> forBigInteger()
        Returns a converter that converts big integers into streams of bits. This returns variable length sequences, depending on the precision of a given big integer. So this converter does not maintain natural ordering of values (unless all values have the same precision and thus same bit length).

      • forBigDecimal

        public static BitConverter<BigDecimal> forBigDecimal()
        Returns a converter that converts big decimals into streams of bits. This returns variable length sequences, depending on the precision and scale of a given big decimal. So this converter does not maintain natural ordering of values.
